Package com.atakmap.android.maps.tilesets

Class TilesetSupport

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.atakmap.android.maps.tilesets.TilesetSupport
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    EquirectangularTilesetSupport, OSMTilesetSupport
    @Deprecated
@DeprecatedApi(since="5.3",
               forRemoval=true,
               removeAt="5.6")
public abstract class TilesetSupport
extends java.lang.Object
    Deprecated.
    migrate to TileMatrix API
    Interface providing access to tile pyramid data.

    Tile row and tile column refer to vertical and horizontal offsets, respectively, into the tile grid. Pixel row and pixel column refer to vertical and horizontal offsets, respectively, into the pixel grid. The pixel grid may be relative to the image extent over the entire tile matrix for a given resolution level or relative to an individual tile.

      • TilesetSupport

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public abstract void start()
        Deprecated.
        Notifies that one or more tiles may be requested via getTile(int, int, int, android.graphics.BitmapFactory.Options). The tileset support may temporarily allocate and retain some additional resources until stop() is invoked in order to improve performance over multiple tile requests.

      • stop

        public abstract void stop()
        Deprecated.
        Notifies the tileset support that the bulk tile request is complete. Any temporarily allocated resources to support the bulk request should be released.

      • getTileBounds

        public abstract double[] getTileBounds​(int latIndex,
                                       int lngIndex,
                                       int level,
                                       double[] swne)
        Deprecated.
        Returns the bounds of the tile, ordered as south, west, north, east.
        Parameters:
        latIndex - The latitude index of the tile
        lngIndex - The longitude index of the tile
        level - The level of the tile
        swne - An optionally pre-allocated array to store the bounds.
        Returns:
        The bounds of the tile, ordered south, west, north, east. If swne is non-null, it will be updated with the bounds and returned.

      • getTilePixelX

        public abstract double getTilePixelX​(int latIndex,
                                     int lngIndex,
                                     int level,
                                     double lng)
        Deprecated.
        Returns the pixel column in the specified tile that corresponds to the specified longitude.
        Parameters:
        latIndex - The tile latitude index
        lngIndex - The tile longitude index
        level - The tile level
        lng - The longitude
        Returns:
        The pixel column in the specified tile that corresponds to the specified longitude. The value may be less than zero or greater than or equal to the tile pixel width in the event that the specified longitude does not intersect the tile.

      • getTilePixelY

        public abstract double getTilePixelY​(int latIndex,
                                     int lngIndex,
                                     int level,
                                     double lat)
        Deprecated.
        Returns the pixel row in the specified tile that corresponds to the specified latitude.
        Parameters:
        latIndex - The tile latitude index
        lngIndex - The tile longitude index
        level - The tile level
        lat - The latitude
        Returns:
        The pixel row in the specified tile that corresponds to the specified latitude. The value may be less than zero or greater than or equal to the tile pixel height in the event that the specified latitude does not intersect the tile.

      • getTilePixelLat

        public abstract double getTilePixelLat​(int latIndex,
                                       int lngIndex,
                                       int level,
                                       int y)
        Deprecated.
        Returns the latitude for the specified pixel row in the specified tile.
        Parameters:
        latIndex - The tile latitude index
        lngIndex - The tile longitude index
        level - The tile level
        y - The pixel row
        Returns:
        The latitude for the specified pixel row of the specified tile.

      • getTile

        public abstract java.util.concurrent.FutureTask<android.graphics.Bitmap> getTile​(int latIndex,
                                                                                 int lngIndex,
                                                                                 int level,
                                                                                 android.graphics.BitmapFactory.Options opts)
        Deprecated.
        Creates a new asynchronous task to load the specified tile.
        Parameters:
        latIndex - The latitude index
        lngIndex - The longitude index
        level - The level
        opts - The BitmapFactory.Options to be used when loading the SmartBitmap. May be null.
        Returns:
        The task created to read the tile.

      • init

        public abstract void init()
        Deprecated.
        Initializes the tileset support. This method will always be invoked prior to any other methods.

        This method may be invoked following a call to release(), allowing the tileset support to be reiniatialized.

      • release

        public abstract void release()
        Deprecated.
        Releases all resources allocated by the tileset support. No methods should be invoked following the invocation of this method without the init() method being invoked first.

      • getTilesVersion

        public int getTilesVersion​(int latIndex,
                           int lngIndex,
                           int level)
        Deprecated.
        Returns the version for the tiles that will be returned via getTile(int, int, int, android.graphics.BitmapFactory.Options). This value may change over the duration of the runtime, indicating that tiles previously read with a different version are not the most up-to-date and should be reloaded. Version numbers should be monotonically increasing.
        Parameters:
        latIndex - The latitude index
        lngIndex - The longitude index
        level - The level
        Returns:
        The current tiles version. The default implementation always returns 0
